meanings.definition: Not visible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent1: The tiny dust particles were subvisible, too small to see without a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The stars in the daytime sky were subvisible, hidden by the brightness of the sun.
meanings.sent3: The ninja moved with subvisible stealth, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like subvisible whispers, barely noticeable but deeply felt.
meanings.sent5: The subvisible details in the painting could only be appreciated up close.

meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure was subvisible, appearing only in the dimmest light.
meanings.sent2: The bacteria on the surface were subvisible, requiring a powerful microscope to be seen.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched for subvisible clues, hoping to crack the case.
meanings.sent4: His influence was subvisible, subtly shaping the decisions of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The subvisible line between reality and dreams blurred in her mind.
